intro: Scaevola scaberula, commonly known as the roughleaf fanflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, fan-shaped clusters of small blue or purple flowers. The plant has hairy, rough-textured leaves that give it its common name, and it typically grows in dry, sandy soils. Scaevola scaberula is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in full sun. It is a hardy perennial that is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
